title: With Acquisition, Kimberly-Clark Bets That Tylenol Can Weather the Storm
summary: The consumer products giant reached a $40 billion deal to buy Kenvue, the maker of Tylenol, despite a barrage of unproven claims from President Trump and others that use of the pain reliever during pregnancy can cause autism.

title: The Battle Over an Activist Who Protested Stephen Miller Near His Virginia Home
summary: Criminal inquiries pit the Miller family’s safety concerns against the First Amendment rights of an activist in Northern Virginia critical of the administration.

title: Houses of Worship Struggle to Feed New Yorkers During SNAP Stalemate
summary: In New York City, there are about 600 food pantries scattered across the five boroughs and at least 90 percent are run by either a religious organization or a nonprofit connected to a place of worship.

title: WIC Food Aid Program for Families Gets Funding Stopgap
summary: An injection of $450 million for WIC comes as the Trump administration announced it would only fund partial benefits for another food aid program, the Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program, or SNAP, for November.

title: Jack Smith, Trump’s Target, Moves From Defense to Counterattack
summary: The former special counsel has told people in his orbit he welcomes the opportunity to present the public case against the president denied to him by adverse court rulings and the 2024 election.

title: Supreme Court Confronts Trump and His Tariffs in Test of Presidential Power
summary: The justices face a so-called legitimacy dilemma as they deal with a tricky legal dispute and a president who has made clear he would view defeat as a personal insult.

title: Ford Foundation Leader Vows to Protect Elections and Law as Trump Threatens Crackdown
summary: Heather K. Gerken, a voting rights scholar and former dean of Yale Law School, plans to intensify its emphasis on democracy as it girds for attacks from the Trump administration.

title: How New York’s Mayoral Race Became a Vote on the Middle East
summary: Many New Yorkers have been agonizing over the war between Israel and Hamas since Oct. 7, 2023. Now they are casting their ballots.

title: What the Virginia Governor Election Might Portend for Trump
summary: The governor’s race in the president’s backyard could tell us if a backlash has arrived.

title: John Irving Talks About ‘Queen Esther,’ Trump and Why He Can’t Stop Writing
summary: The literary titan is still publishing books, and still pushing envelopes, at 83. But you will not see him in the United States anytime soon.

title: After Hurricane Melissa, a Seaside Town in Jamaica Picks Up the Pieces
summary: The devastation caused by Hurricane Melissa in Black River, Jamaica, reflects the broader destruction and rebuilding facing many Jamaican communities.

title: ICE Altercation With Protester in Colorado Prompts a Police Chief to Push Back
summary: At the Durango, Colo., police chief’s request, Colorado law enforcement will investigate whether a federal agent broke the law when he appeared to put a protester in a chokehold.

title: China Started Separating Its Economy From the West Years Ago
summary: Two decades of sustained effort to build national self-reliance and minimize imports have antagonized trade partners but fortified what a senior adviser called Beijing’s “bulwark” against conflicts.

title: Diane Ladd, Oscar-Nominated Actress and Mother of Laura Dern, Dies at 89
summary: She was a three-time Oscar contender playing strikingly different characters, in one case starring alongside her daughter and fellow nominee, Laura Dern.

title: Dodger Fans Celebrate World Series Victory at Los Angeles Parade
summary: Tens of thousands of Dodger fans attended a parade and rally on Monday, a joyful moment celebrating the team’s World Series win in what has been a turbulent year for Los Angeles.

title: A Celebrated French Writer Loved Russia. War Forced a Reckoning.
summary: Emmanuel Carrère’s best sellers on Russia grew out of a deep affection. Since Moscow invaded Ukraine, he has traveled to the war-torn country to rethink his views.

title: Halloween Becomes Another Target of the Kremlin’s Culture Wars
summary: The Russian authorities canceled a festival in St. Petersburg, branding it “Satanist,” as part of a larger assault on anything viewed as a Western influence.

title: How A.I. Is Transforming Dating Apps
summary: Meet your artificial intelligence matchmakers. These A.I. tools are changing dating apps, so users don’t have to swipe through an endless scroll of profiles.

title: Facebook Dating Has Become a Surprise Hit for the Social Network
summary: Facebook’s free dating service has 21 million users, more than the popular dating app Hinge, as the social network reinvents itself.

title: Trump’s China Trade and Tariff Policy Is a Hot Mess
summary: As he so often does, the president is pushing the wrong answer to the right question on trade policy with Beijing.

title: These Israeli Dissidents Can Show Americans How to Be a Good Citizen of a Bad Country
summary: And why it matters so much to try.

title: The Trump Administration Plans to Offer Only Partial Food Stamp Benefits
summary: Also, Election Day is tomorrow for millions of Americans. Here’s the latest at the end of Monday.

title: Do You Rely on Food Stamps? Tell Us About How You’re Preparing for the Possible Loss of Assistance.
summary: As food assistance funding runs out, Times reporters want to hear from people who rely on it, or who work to help feed people in their community.

title: Donna Jean Godchaux-MacKay, Grateful Dead Singer, Dies at 78
summary: She helped shape the band’s sound in the 1970s, a decade that took the band to new heights.

title: ‘The Boat,’ Despised Floating Jail Near Rikers, Heads for the Scrap Heap
summary: The jail barge, officially called the Vernon C. Bain Center, was a relic of the crack cocaine era. It was notorious even among Rikers Island’s many troubled lockups.

title: Meet the Billionaire Trying to Save College Football From Itself
summary: Cody Campbell, an oilman, has spent millions paying students to play football at Texas Tech. Now he worries that people like him are ruining college sports.

title: Starbucks to Sell 60% of Its China Business to a Private Equity Firm
summary: In a deal valued at $4 billion, Boyu Capital will acquire a stake in the coffee giant’s 8,000 stores in China.
